alert.note: Alert for Anson; Davidson; Montgomery; Randolph; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Davidson, northwestern Anson, western Montgomery, southwestern Randolph and Stanly Counties through 930 PM EDT... At 844 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mt Pleasant to near Plyler to 6 miles north of Ansonville. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albemarle, Badin Lake, Plyler, Fairview In Union County, Locust, Norwood, Badin, Oakboro, Denton and Stanfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
